content: What chemical element has the atomic number 1 and is the lightest element on the periodic table?

The chemical element with atomic number 1 is hydrogen (H). It is indeed the lightest element on the periodic table, consisting of one proton and one electron. Hydrogen is unique among elements because it has no neutrons in its most common isotope, protium. It plays a vital role in chemistry and is essential for life as we know it, being a key component of water and many organic compounds.
